title: How do we write 6:30 in Sanskrit? - Quora

response.answer_text: The words 6:30 is usually associated with the time of the day. If one wants to say the time is 6:30, one could use the numbers 6 and 30 to say so. It is also possible to say: it is half past six. In Sanskrit, the latter method is used. So 6:30 as a fact of the time of the day would be: स अर्ध षड वादने. Because of rules of Sandhi in Sanskrit - well defined rules which govern how to join two adjoining alphabets to facilitate better pronunciation (actually articulation) 6:30 in Sanskrit would be written as सार्ध षड वादने meaning half after six. The two words स अर्ध are articulated as if they are one word by Sandhi rules to be written and articulated as सार्ध वादने. I hope this helps.
